item.description:
This out-and-back hike skirts the steep bluffs above the Westfield River, providing a surprising amount of solitude for a park just seven miles from downtown Springfield. But it’s bigger than it looks—Robinson has over 800 acres, including more than five miles of river frontage. The Westfield River drains the creeks and brooks of the Berkshires into the Connecticut River at Springfield.
